metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0435 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A stack overflow flaw was found in the Linux kernel's TIPC protocolfunctionality in the way a user sends a packet with malicious content wherethe number of domain member nodes is higher than the 64 allowed. This flawallows a remote user to crash the system or possibly escalate theirprivileges if they have access to the TIPC network.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0435` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
